feed.title: Category: debugger | a m4lefic security blog

entry.title: GDB
entry.content:
GDB Debug Symbols

  • Gives various information about variables, functions, etc in a binary that can be read by the debugger
  • Can be part of the binary or a separate file
  • GCC -ggdb to compile with debug symbols for gdb

- list will drop us to the main function if it has the source available - list # will take you to that line of the source - if compiled with dbg symbols info variables will display found variables under defined for the source file - if not compiled with symbols or source not available, the variables may be found and listed under non-debugging symbols

- here we use info functions to display all functions found in the source with debug options given at compile time
